name: Razortooth Goblin Jaws
desc: Your family's teeth are formidable weapons. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits.

name: Tiger Claw
criticalHint: On a critical success with your tiger claws, if you deal damage, the target takes |dice=1d4 Persistent Bleed| 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

name: Clan Dagger
desc: This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.

name: Club
desc: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

name: Dagger
desc: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

name: Gauntlet
desc: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

name: Katar
desc: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

name: Light Mace
desc: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head's metal ridges or spikes.

name: Longspear
desc: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

name: Mace
desc: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

name: Morningstar
desc: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

name: Sickle
desc: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

name: Spear
desc: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

name: Spiked Gauntlet
desc: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

name: Staff
desc: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

name: Bastard Sword
desc: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand‑and‑a‑half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

name: Battle Axe
desc: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

name: Bo Staff
desc: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

name: Dogslicer
desc: This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It's a favored weapon of goblins.

name: Elven Curve Blade
desc: Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

name: Falchion
desc: This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade's end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.

name: Filcher's Fork
desc: This halfling weapon looks like a long, two-pronged fork and is used as both a weapon and a cooking implement.

name: Flail
desc: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

name: Glaive
desc: This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

name: Gnome Hooked Hammer
desc: This gnome tool and weapon features a hammer at one end and a curved pick on the other. It's such a strange and awkward weapon that others think the gnomes are slightly erratic for using it.

name: Greataxe
desc: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

name: Greatclub
desc: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

name: Greatpick
desc: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

name: Greatsword
desc: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

name: Guisarme
desc: This polearm bears a long, often one‑sided, curved blade with a hook protruding from the blunt side of the blade, which can allow its wielder to trip opponents at a distance. Its shaft is usually 8 feet long.

name: Halberd
desc: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

name: Hatchet
desc: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

name: Horsechopper
desc: Created by goblins to battle horses, this weapon is essentially a long shaft ending in a blade with a large hook.

name: Kama
desc: Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.

name: Katana
desc: A katana is a curved, single-edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.

name: Kukri
desc: The blade of this foot-long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.

name: Lance
desc: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.

name: Light Hammer
desc: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

name: Light Pick
desc: A light pick is a modified mining implement with a wooden shaft ending in a pick head crafted more to pierce armor and flesh than chip rocks.

name: Longsword
desc: Longswords can be one-edged or two‑edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

name: Main-gauche
desc: This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder's hand.

name: Maul
desc: Mauls are massive warhammers that must be swung with two hands.

name: Nunchaku
desc: The nunchaku is constructed of two wooden or metal bars connected by a short length of rope or chain.

name: Orc Knuckle Dagger
desc: This stout, metal blade of orc design has a horizontal basket hilt with blades jutting from each end, or sometimes one blade like that of a katar.

name: Pick
desc: A pick designed solely for combat has a sturdy wooden shaft and a heavy, pointed head to deliver devastating blows.

name: Ranseur
desc: This polearm is a long trident with a central prong that's longer than the other two.

name: Rapier
desc: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

name: Sai
desc: This piercing dagger is a metal spike flanked by a pair of prongs that can be used to trap an enemy's weapon.

name: Sap
desc: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

name: Scimitar
desc: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

name: Scythe
desc: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

name: Shield Bash
desc: A shield bash is not actually a weapon, but a maneuver in which you thrust or swing your shield to hit your foe with an impromptu attack.

name: Shield Boss
desc: Typically a round, convex, or conical piece of thick metal attached to the center of a shield, a shield boss increases the bludgeoning damage of a shield bash.

name: Shield Spikes
desc: These metal spikes are strategically placed on the defensive side of the shield to deal piercing damage with a shield bash.

name: Shortsword
desc: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

name: Spiked Chain
desc: This 4‑foot‑long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

name: Starknife
desc: From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.

name: Temple Sword
desc: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

name: Trident
desc: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

name: War Flail
desc: This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that's sometimes inlaid with spikes.

name: Warhammer
desc: This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it's always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

name: Whip
desc: This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

name: Dwarven War Axe
desc: This favored weapon of the dwarves has a large, ornate head mounted on a thick handle. This powerful axe can be wielded with one hand or two.

name: Gnome Flickmace
desc: More a flail than a mace, this weapon has a short handle attached to a length of chain with a ball at the end. The ball is propelled to its reach with the flick of the wrist, the momentum of which brings the ball back to the wielder after the strike.

name: Orc Necksplitter
desc: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that's perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

name: Sawtooth Saber
desc: The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.

name: Blowgun
desc: This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

name: Crossbow
desc: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

name: Dart
desc: This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.

name: Hand Crossbow
desc: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

name: Heavy Crossbow
desc: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

name: Javelin
desc: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

name: Sling
desc: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

name: Composite Longbow
desc: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

name: Composite Shortbow
desc: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

name: Halfling Sling Staff
desc: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two‑handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

name: Longbow
desc: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can't be used while mounted.

name: Shortbow
desc: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

name: Shuriken
desc: This "throwing star" is a small piece of flat metal with sharp edges, designed to be flung with a flick of the wrist.

name: Twining Staff
desc: Appearing to be just a small, flat disc made of twigs, this item can grow and shrink.

activities.desc:
You cause the twigs to rapidly grow or contract, reshaping into a +1 striking staff, a +1 striking bo staff, or its disc form. In its disc form, it has negligible Bulk and must be held in one hand to be activated. In the other forms, it has the same Bulk as a normal weapon of its type. You can switch your grip as part of the activation.

When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.
activities.name: Twining Staff: Staff

activities.desc:
You cause the twigs to rapidly grow or contract, reshaping into a +1 striking staff, a +1 striking bo staff, or its disc form. In its disc form, it has negligible Bulk and must be held in one hand to be activated. In the other forms, it has the same Bulk as a normal weapon of its type. You can switch your grip as part of the activation.

When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.
activities.name: Twining Staff: Bo Staff

hints.desc: When you expand the Twining Staff, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.

name: Bo Staff (Twining Staff)
desc: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

name: Staff (Twining Staff)
desc: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

name: Lion's Head Shield Boss
desc: The lion's head functions as +1 striking shield boss that can't be removed from the shield.

name: Lion's Shield Biting Maw
desc: The shield's biting maw is a martial melee weapon that deals 2d6 piercing damage and has the deadly 1d6 trait; it can't be enhanced by runes. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, during which time you can Strike with it each time you Raise the Shield, as well as with a Strike action.

name: Spined Shield Spikes
desc:
Five jagged spines project from the surface of the Spined Shield. The spines are +1 striking shield spikes.

When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines regenerate the next day.

name: Whip (Feather Token)
desc: This whip immediately jumps from your grasp and proceeds to attack your enemies until 1 minute has passed or it fails its flat check for dancing, at which point it vanishes. If the whip's target isn't prone, the whip uses its actions to attempt to Trip that creature instead of making a Strike. The whip's total attack modifier for Striking or Tripping is +18 instead of the normal bonus for a dancing weapon.

name: Dinosaur Form Triceratops Horn
criticalHint: Whenever you score a critical hit with your Horn unarmed attack, your target takes |dice=1d6 Persistent Bleed| 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

name: Dinosaur Form Triceratops Horn (5th Level)
criticalHint: Whenever you score a critical hit with your Horn unarmed attack, your target takes |dice=1d6 Persistent Bleed| 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

name: Wild Morph Wild Claws
desc: Your hands are transformed into incredibly sharp claws. These claws are an unarmed attack you're trained in and deal 1d6 slashing damage each (agile, finesse). You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you cannot hold an item while attacking.

name: Wild Morph Wild Claws (6th Level)
desc: Your hands are transformed into incredibly sharp claws. These claws are an unarmed attack you're trained in and deal 1d6 slashing damage each (agile, finesse). They leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit. You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you cannot hold an item while attacking.

name: Wild Morph Wild Claws (10th Level)
desc: Your hands are transformed into incredibly sharp claws. These claws are an unarmed attack you're trained in and deal 1d6 slashing damage each (agile, finesse). They leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit. You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you cannot hold an item while attacking.

name: Wild Morph Wild Jaws
desc: You have transformed your mouth into wild jaws, an unarmed attack you're trained in that deals 1d8 piercing damage.

name: Wild Morph Wild Jaws (6th Level)
desc: You have transformed your mouth into wild jaws, an unarmed attack you're trained in that deals 1d8 piercing damage and is envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.

name: Wild Morph Wild Jaws (10th Level)
desc: You have transformed your mouth into wild jaws, an unarmed attack you're trained in that deals 1d8 piercing damage and is envenomed, also dealing 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.

name: Elemental Form Water Wave
hitEffect: You can spend an action immediately after a hit to push the target 5 feet with the effects of a successful Shove.

name: Plant Form Flytrap Leaf
hitEffect: You can spend an action after a hit to Grab the target.

name: Moon Frenzy Fangs
criticalHint: On a critical hit, the creature struck takes |dice=1d4 Persistent Bleed| 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

name: Moon Frenzy Claws
criticalHint: On a critical hit, the creature struck takes |dice=1d4 Persistent Bleed| 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

name: Spiritual Weapon
desc: A weapon made of pure magical force attacks foes you designate within range. This weapon has a ghostly appearance and manifests as a club, a dagger or your deity's favored weapon.
